blocks.text: application of the integral, however, $X$ is a small quantity, and a sufficiently correct result is obtained by expanding in a series and calculating from a few terms in this series.

blocks.description: This equation represents the relationship involving the variable $X$, derived from a definite integral.
This equation shows the rewritten form of the earlier equation involving the variable $V$.

blocks.text: or if for $X$ we again write $X = 443 - 2 \times \frac{43}{42} + \ldots$ terms which are very small.
By selecting values of $X$ and plotting, the solution of this equation is found, the final plot being represented in Fig. 141, where it is seen that the solution is $X = -4769$.

blocks.caption: Figure 141
blocks.description: The figure depicts the graphical representation of the solution to the equation for varying values of $X$.
